problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A car accelerates uniformly from rest and covers 100 m in 5 seconds. Find its acceleration.
problems.detailed: With \(s=100, t=5, u=0\): \(100 = \tfrac{1}{2}a(25)\). So \(a=8\,\text{m/s}^2\). Final velocity: \(v=at=8\times5=40\,\text{m/s}\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A ball is thrown straight up with speed \(20\,\text{m/s}\). Find the total time before it comes back to the ground. (Take \(g=10\,\text{m/s}^2\))
problems.detailed: Time to reach max height: \(t = u/g = 20/10 = 2\,s\). Total time = \(2\times2 = 4\,s\).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A stone is dropped from a height of 80 m. At the same time, another stone is thrown upward from the ground with speed \(20\,\text{m/s}\). After how many seconds do they meet? (Take \(g=10\,\text{m/s}^2\)).
problems.hint: Set distances from ground equal at meeting point.
problems.detailed: For falling stone: \(y_1 = 80 - 5t^2\). For rising stone: \(y_2 = 20t - 5t^2\). At meeting: \(y_1 = y_2\). So: \(80 - 5t^2 = 20t - 5t^2\). Cancels to \(80=20t\). Thus \(t=4\,s\). (Correction: exact answer is 4s, option should be C.)
